chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
T: poset
x: sort T

Goal:
x <== x

Premises:
sort = fun t : poset => let (sort, _, _) := t in sort : poset -> Type sort is a coercion
Notation poset := type
Pack : forall sort : Type, class_of sort -> Type -> poset
Record type : Type := Pack { sort : Type; _ : Equality.mixin_of sort } Arguments Equality.Pack [sort]%type_scope
pack : forall (T : Type) (m0 m : mixin_of T), phant_id m0 m -> poset
clone : forall (T : Type) (cT : poset) (c : class_of T), phant_id (class cT) c -> poset
Equality.sort = fun t : eqType => let (sort, _) := t in sort : eqType -> Type Equality.sort is a coercion
Record type : Type := Pack { sort : Type; _ : class_of sort; _ : Type } Arguments Pack [sort]%type_scope _ _%type_scope
Relation_Operators.clos_trans_sind : forall (A : Type) (R : Relation_Definitions.relation A) (P : A -> A -> SProp), (forall x y : A, R x y -> P x y) -> (forall x y z : A, Relation_Operators.clos_trans A R x y -> P x y -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans A R y z -> P y z -> P x z) -> forall x a : A, Relation_Operators.clos_trans A R x a -> P x a
total_homo_mono : forall (aT rT : eqType) (f : aT -> rT) (aR aR' : rel aT) (rR rR' : rel rT), reflexive aR -> reflexive rR -> (forall x y : aT, aR' x y = (x != y) && aR x y) -> (forall x y : rT, rR' x y = (x != y) && rR x y) -> antisymmetric rR -> total aR -> {homo f : x y / aR' x y > -> rR' x y} -> {mono f : x y / aR x y > -> rR x y}
Record mixin_of (T : Type) : Type := Mixin { mx_leq : T -> T -> Prop; _ : forall x : T, mx_leq x x; _ : forall x y : T, mx_leq x y -> mx_leq y x -> x = y; _ : forall x y z : T, mx_leq x y -> mx_leq y z -> mx_leq x z } Arguments mixin_of _%type_scope Arguments Mixin [T]%type_scope [mx_leq]%function_scope (_ _ _)%function_scope
BinPos.Pos.ltb_ge : forall x y : BinNums.positive, BinPos.Pos.ltb x y = false < -> BinPos.Pos.le y x
BinPos.Pos.compare_ngt_iff : forall x y : BinNums.positive, BinPos.Pos.compare x y <> Gt < -> ~ BinPos.Pos.lt y x
BinPos.Pos.ltb_nlt : forall x y : BinNums.positive, BinPos.Pos.ltb x y = false < -> ~ BinPos.Pos.lt x y
Record almost_ring_theory (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_art { ARadd_0_l : forall x : R, req (radd rO x) x; ARadd_comm : forall x y : R, req (radd x y) (radd y x); ARadd_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (radd x (radd y z)) (radd (radd x y) z); ARmul_1_l : forall x : R, req (rmul rI x) x; ARmul_0_l : forall x : R, req (rmul rO x) rO; ARmul_comm : forall x y : R, req (rmul x y) (rmul y x); ARmul_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (rmul x (rmul y z)) (rmul (rmul x y) z); ARdistr_l : forall x y z : R, req (rmul (...
filter_nseq : forall (T : Type) (a : pred T) (n : nat) (x : T), [seq x <- nseq n x | a x] = nseq (a x * n) x
Setoid.Seq_refl : forall (A : Type) (Aeq : Relation_Definitions.relation A), Setoid.Setoid_Theory A Aeq -> forall x : A, Aeq x x
Setoid.Seq_sym : forall (A : Type) (Aeq : Relation_Definitions.relation A), Setoid.Setoid_Theory A Aeq -> forall x y : A, Aeq x y -> Aeq y x
Setoid.Seq_trans : forall (A : Type) (Aeq : Relation_Definitions.relation A), Setoid.Setoid_Theory A Aeq -> forall x y z : A, Aeq x y -> Aeq y z -> Aeq x z
List.filter_In : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (x : A) (l : seq A), List.In x (List.filter f l) < -> List.In x l /\ f x = true
eq_mem = fun (T : Type) (mp1 mp2 : mem_pred T) => forall x : T, in_mem x mp1 = in_mem x mp2 : forall T : Type, mem_pred T -> mem_pred T -> Prop Arguments eq_mem {T}%type_scope
sub_mem = fun (T : Type) (mp1 mp2 : mem_pred T) => forall x : T, in_mem x mp1 -> in_mem x mp2 : forall T : Type, mem_pred T -> mem_pred T -> Prop Arguments sub_mem {T}%type_scope
BinNat.N.lt = fun x y : BinNums.N => BinNat.N.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> Prop Arguments BinNat.N.lt (_ _)%N_scope
BinPos.Pos.lt = fun x y : BinNums.positive => BinPos.Pos.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive -> Prop Arguments BinPos.Pos.lt (_ _)%positive_scope
BinNat.N.le = fun x y : BinNums.N => BinNat.N.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> Prop Arguments BinNat.N.le (_ _)%N_scope
BinInt.Z.lt = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
BinInt.Z.le = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
BinPos.Pos.le = fun x y : BinNums.positive => BinPos.Pos.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive -> Prop Arguments BinPos.Pos.le (_ _)%positive_scope
BinPos.Pos.gt = fun x y : BinNums.positive => BinPos.Pos.compare x y = Gt : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive -> Prop Arguments BinPos.Pos.gt (_ _)%positive_scope
Inductive clos_trans (A : Type) (R : Relation_Definitions.relation A) (x : A) : A -> Prop := t_step : forall y : A, R x y -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans A R x y | t_trans : forall y z : A, Relation_Operators.clos_trans A R x y -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans A R y z -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans A R x z Arguments Relation_Operators.clos_trans _%type_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.t_step _%type_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.t_trans _%type_scope
List.Exists_exists : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : seq A), List.Exists P l < -> (exists x : A, List.In x l /\ P x)
ARmul_1_r : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x : R, req (rmul x rI) x
BinPosDef.Pos.ltb = fun x y : BinNums.positive => match BinPosDef.Pos.compare x y with | Lt => true | _ => false end : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive -> bool Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.ltb (_ _)%positive_scope
ARmul_assoc : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y z : R, req (rmul x (rmul y z)) (rmul (rmul x y) z)
anti_leq = fun m n : nat => (fun _evar_0_ : m == n -> m = n => eq_ind (m == n) (fun _pattern_value_ : bool => _pattern_value_ -> m = n) _evar_0_ (m <= n <= m) (eqn_leq m n)) (fun _view_subject_ : m == n => id (elimTF eqP _view_subject_)) : antisymmetric ssrnat.leq Expanded type for implicit arguments anti_leq : forall x y : nat, x <= y <= x -> x = y Arguments anti_leq [x y]
BinIntDef.Z.opp = fun x : BinNums.Z => match x with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.Z0 | BinNums.Zpos x0 => BinNums.Zneg x0 | BinNums.Zneg x0 => BinNums.Zpos x0 end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.opp _%Z_scope
Record ring_morph (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R) : Prop := mkmorph { morph0 : req (phi cO) rO; morph1 : req (phi cI) rI; morph_add : forall x y : C, req (phi (cadd x y)) (radd (phi x) (phi y)); morph_sub : forall x y : C, req (phi (csub x y)) (rsub (phi x) (phi y)); morph_mul : forall x y : C, req (phi (cmul x y)) (rmul (phi x) (phi y)); morph_opp : forall x : C, req (phi (copp x)) (ropp (phi x)); morph_eq : forall x y...
ZCoeff.req_trans : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (rplus rtimes rminus : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req rle rlt : R -> R -> Prop), OrderedRing.SOR rO rI rplus rtimes rminus ropp req rle rlt -> forall x y z : R, req x y -> req y z -> req x z
filter = fun (T : Type) (a : pred T) => fix filter (s : seq T) : seq T := match s with | [::] => [::] | x :: s' => if a x then x :: filter s' else filter s' end : forall T : Type, pred T -> seq T -> seq T Arguments filter {T}%type_scope _ _%seq_scope
BinIntDef.Z.pow = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.Zpos BinNums.xH | BinNums.Zpos p => BinIntDef.Z.pow_pos x p | BinNums.Zneg _ => BinNums.Z0 end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.pow (_ _)%Z_scope
ARmul_1_l : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x : R, req (rmul rI x) x
Inductive Exists (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) : forall n : nat, VectorDef.t A n -> Prop := Exists_cons_hd : forall (m : nat) (x : A) (v : VectorDef.t A m), P x -> VectorDef.Exists P (VectorDef.cons A x m v) | Exists_cons_tl : forall (m : nat) (x : A) (v : VectorDef.t A m), VectorDef.Exists P v -> VectorDef.Exists P (VectorDef.cons A x m v) Arguments VectorDef.Exists {A}%type_scope _%function_scope {n}%nat_scope Arguments VectorDef.Exists_cons_hd {A}%type_scope _%function_scope {m}%nat_scope Arguments VectorDef.Exists_cons_tl {A}%type_scope _%function_scope {m}%nat_scope
